adjectives.description: gleby (comparative more gleby, superlative most gleby)

entries.meaning: Relating to the glebe; turfy; cloddy; fertile; fruitful.
examples: Pernicious flattery! thy malignant seedsIn an ill hour, and by fatal handSadly diffus'd o'er virtue's gleby land,With rising pride amidst the corn appear,And choke the hopes and harvest of the year.
